title: Introduction to Crochet
headline: Learn basic concepts and processes for making beautiful crochet objects from scratch with this free online course.
description: Crocheting is a productive and relaxing exercise that anyone can attempt. All you need is to familiarise yourself with the basic procedures, equipment and materials to start this craft. Learn basic crochet stitches and select the necessary materials, supplies and equipment sizes suitable for each crochet project you choose to make. Become adept at crocheting by completing stunning craft articles for personal use or as gift items.

courseDescription:
One of the main benefits of crocheting is maintaining a stable mental state and a happier mood. Crocheting is not only a craft but also an antidepressant and mood-lifting skill everyone should strive to possess. Primarily, you must first understand the rudiments of crocheting. You will learn the importance of having such skills as a hobby or business. The selection of hook and yarn type plays a vital role. Study the different hooks and yarn to suit your chosen crochet project. These come in many sizes. Explore their sizes and identify the purpose and use of each one. The course will teach you about the two camps of thought when holding a crochet hook. Study the two techniques of holding a crochet hook and decide which approach to adapt to suit you.

Another essential aspect is to familiarise yourself with the different types of yarn, yarn fibres, skeins, balls, hanks and yarn weight. Nothing beats good old hand sewing when it comes to crocheting. Become an expert in hand sewing, threading needles, double or single thread, hand basting and knotting the thread. In addition, specialise in the different kinds of basic and advanced crochet stitches such as slipknot, yarn over, foundation chain, eyelet, single crochet ribbing and more. Next, you will learn some beginner-friendly crochet patterns and projects, each with their required materials, measurement and procedures. These will give you a solid footing in mastering the craft. Grasp some easy crochet techniques that are rather useful for producing beautiful crochet pieces. These will cement your understanding and skillful acquisition of the art.

Are you curious about starting a crochet business? This course delves into quality control, quality assurance, the benefits of quality control and the improvement teams that improve how you make a product or deliver a service. For any business, satisfying the customers is essential to the growth and sustainability of a company. We outline the Kano model of customer satisfaction and explain how you can apply it to your business. Our instructor presents the steps needed for establishing a customer relationship management programme. With your newfound knowledge of quality control and how to understand customer expectations and needs, you will be able to produce goods that will leave your customers satisfied. This course is for everyone. Whether you want to learn the skill as a hobby or aim to start a crochet business, enrol in this course today and get started.

Start Course Now
certificateDetail:
All Alison courses are free to enrol study and complete. To successfully complete this certificate course and become an Alison Graduate, you need to achieve 80% or higher in each course assessment. Once you have completed this certificate course, you have the option to acquire an official Diploma, which is a great way to share your achievement with the world.

Your Alison certificate is:
  • Ideal for sharing with potential employers
  • Include it in your CV, professional social media profiles and job applications.
  • An indication of your commitment to continuously learn, upskill & achieve high results.
  • An incentive for you to continue empowering yourself through lifelong learning.
Alison offers 3 types of Diplomas for completed Diploma courses:
  • Digital certificate: a downloadable certificate in PDF format immediately available to you when you complete your purchase.
  • certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security-marked certificate, posted to you with FREE shipping.
  • Framed certificate: a physical version of your officially branded and security marked certificate in a stylish frame, posted to you with FREE shipping.
Start Course Now

All certificate are available to purchase through the Alison Shop. For more information on purchasing Alison certificate, please visit our FAQs. If you decide not to purchase your Alison certificate, you can still demonstrate your achievement by sharing your Learner Record or Learner Achievement Verification, both of which are accessible from your Dashboard. For more details on our certificate pricing, please visit our Pricing Page

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn the basics of crochet, common terms in crochet, essential types of equipment that are used for crochet, the basic definition of yarns which are important for crochet, yarn choosing factor, the working process of hand stitches and regular stitches, the basic and advanced crochet stitches, and beginner crochet patterns.

modules.name: Module
modules.description: In this module, you will learn some easy crochet techniques which are quite helpful for making some beautiful crochet, beginners level crochet projects, and tricks to help you brush up your crochet skills. Then you will learn quality control and how to understand customer expectations and needs which is essential for building a successful business.
topics: Crochet Techniques and Projects - Learning Outcomes
Crochet Techniques and Projects - Lesson Summary

slides:
• Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Recognize the basics of crochet.
    • Explain crotchet supplies.
    • Outline the most commonly used terms of crochet.
    • List the types of equipment that are used for crochet.
    • Define crochet yarn and recognize the source of yarn.
    • Explain the three basic types of fibres.
    • Discuss the process of hand stitching.

  • Lesson Summary

    • Crochet is a pleasant and calming activity that anyone can do. It can help you to be productive even during the most boring times.
    • Crochet is easy to learn and requires very little investment.
    • Crochet is a dynamic skill to begin a lifetime fascination with fashion, art, or Mathematics.
    • There are three categories of yarn fibres: plant fibres, animal fibres, and synthetic fibres.
    • The size of the crotchet hook determines the size of your stitches.
    • Crochet is an extensive form of art that includes creating a beautiful fabric from given yarn sometimes called thread or many yarn material strands using a number of crotchet hooks.
    • Steel hooks with tiny hook sizes are used for delicate thread and lacework.
    • Tunisian crochet hooks also called Afghan hooks are longer than traditional crochet hooks.
    • There are two camps of thought when it comes to holding a crochet hook. One is the pencil hold, and one is the knife hold.
    • Stitch markers are used to mark the beginning of a pattern repeat, the beginning of a round when crocheting in the round and colour changes.
    • Crochet thread or yarn is a specially designed thread that is most usually made from cotton for creating or designing new decorative and artful crochet items.

  •  Learning Outcomes

  • Having completed this module you will be able to:
    • Recognize and distinguish the various crochet techniques.
    • Explain the procedures for beads on single and double crochet.
    • Distinguish between double crochet with bead on the right and wrong sides.
    • Outline the broomstick lace basic techniques and procedures.
    • Describe the crocheting doilies techniques.
    • Identify the basic measurement for triangle bunting.
    • Define quality control and quality assurance.
    • Discuss the concept of quality circles, and quality improvement teams.
    • Analyze the benefits of quality control.

  • Quality Control

  • Select your Video URL in the Edit Panel

  • Lesson Summary

    • Before crocheting a beginning chain, string beads on yarn and make a slip knot in the yarn, and work several chain stitches.
    • The bead in double crochet can rest on either the right side or the wrong side of the piece depending on when you push the bead into place.
    • Blocking means setting the finished doily into its final size and shape.
    • Felting can be done in a sink, but washing machines get the job done more quickly.
    • Three simple flannel sizes should be 7 inches square, yarn is about 50 m, and hook size should be 5.5 mm.
    • Triangle bunting size should be 4 1/2 inches wide; yarn is about 14 m.
    • Materials needed for the baby bath are flannels are crochet hook 5.5 mm, cotton yarn, and yarn needle.
    • Required materials for infinitely cow scarf cloths are crochet hook 10.5 mm and chunky yarn.
    • Quality control is a system that maintains a desired level of quality, through feedback on product or service characteristics and implementation of remedial actions.
    • Quality assurance is a system that ensures that all procedures that have been designed and planned are followed.
    • A quality circle is an informal group of people who get together to improve ways to make a product or deliver a service.
